0,Industrial_Gas_Turbines_AMY_Razak.txt,257,d21f41d85f93ebda378d38a8a65250d444f055bf9c77d18f170b7b355e334bed,"The fuel flow and the fuel valve position remain essentially constant due to the thermal efficiency remaining approximately constant as shown in Fig. 16.31. The small decrease in compressor air flow and approximately constant fuel flow results in a slight decrease in the air–fuel ratio.
# 16.4.6 Trends in pressure

The trends in pressure during this transient are shown in Figure 16.35. During the period after the gas turbine power limit is reached, the compressor discharge and turbine inlet pressures decrease. This is due to the decrease in the compressor pressure ratio, as shown in Fig. 16.30, in order to satisfy the flow compatibility between the compressor and turbine.
# 16.4.7 Trends in turbine creep life

The trend in turbine creep life usage is similar to the case when the VIGV remains fully open, as discussed in Section 16.2.4. However, the turbine creep life usage is greater during the period of constant power output, as
# Simulating the effects of ambient temperature on performance

shown in Fig. ",What role does the VIGV play in gas turbine operation during temperature transients?,It adjusts to maintain performance and protect the turbine under varying temperature conditions.,The VIGV modulates airflow to optimize turbine operation during temperature changes.,Its adjustment is crucial for managing flow and pressure dynamics in response to temperature shifts.,"By closing or opening, the VIGV helps sustain turbine efficiency and life during transients.",The VIGV's role is pivotal in adapting the turbine's operation to ambient temperature variations.
